caption: The Invalides Bridge (Pont des Invalides) in Paris is a beautiful and historic spot that offers stunning views of the Seine and the Eiffel Tower. It‚Äôs less crowded than some of the other bridges, making it a peaceful place to walk or take photos. The architecture is impressive, and it's especially lovely at sunset when the whole area glows with golden light. It's a great place for a leisurely stroll, and you can easily connect to nearby attractions like Les Invalides and the Champs-√âlys√©es. Definitely worth a visit!

This bridge over the Seine is quite an oddity in that it does not relate to a person or location. It is close to Les Invalides but does not lead to it. Either side has large decorative figurines sticking out from the pillars.
Nice view of seine river
A stone bridge spanning the seine with ornate arches
Pont des Invalides is the lowest bridge over the River Seine.
Such a lovely view of Paris!

The Invalides Bridge is in close proximity to several notable landmarks. On the Left Bank, you can find the H√¥tel des Invalides, which houses the Mus√©e de l'Arm√©e (Army Museum) and the Tomb of Napoleon. On the Right Bank, you can explore the prestigious Avenue des Champs-√âlys√©es and the Grand Palais.
On way to tower near river
Breathtaking

a fantastic experience walking the bridges to Paris in winter 2024 under a sun with a clear cloudless sky the bridges and paths along the banks of the River Seine provide a journey beyond imagination with wonderful images of the Eifel Tower and the River
This bridge is really beautiful, especially at night! The Eiffel Tower is magnificent to contemplate too! It is obviously possible to go riverboat here, to see!
What to say? A legendary bridge in Paris and I saw it during the Paralympic games and the triathlon. Magic!
PONT DES INVALIDES PARIS A HISTORIC BRIDGE AND AN ARCHITECTURAL MARVEL LOCATED 5 MINUTES BETWEEN THE EIFFEL TOWER PARIS AND PONT ALEXANDRE III PARIS ALL OF THESE SITES ARE ACCESSIBLE TO WHEELCHAIR
It is one of the old bridges in Paris, with a classic design (three pillars). Its lighting makes it very beautiful at night. It is a pleasure both to cross it and to contemplate it from a distance.

Curiosity: the Pont des Invalides does not lead to Les Invalides. This privilege is reserved for ‚ÄúAlexander III‚Äù.  Without being as astonishing as the famous Pont Alexandre III, that of the Invalides is a beautiful and sober construction from the 19th century. We imagine that the old Pont de l'Alma was of the same type. So we can be happy that the Invalides building was not demolished for the same reasons (construction too low, it seems). Because the replacement of the Pont de l'Alma was an architectural disaster.

This bridge is a bit flawed, its first version was not completed, later they moved to its current location but it was not highly recommended to cross it due to its weakness and finally they modified it by adding a new arch and then it continued to undergo various modifications.
You can see the Eiffel Tower from here. It's very beautiful at night.
It's incredible but it's more difficult to leave the Olympic zones to return home than to arrive at rue du Faubourg Saint Honor√©
Beautiful bridge at sunset  2021.11
You can cross the Invalid Army Bridge when traveling along the river.
I love everything that connects men.

Be careful for tourists, the Invalides bridge is not the one which spans the Seine opposite the Invalides (it is the Alexandre III bridge which allows you to have the view while crossing the Seine). From my point of view it is not the most beautiful bridge in Paris.
